attributes.action: Prevent Coventry Airport from being developed into a gigafactory
attributes.additional_details:
1) Coventry Airport remains a vital part of the UK's pilot training infrastructure.  

2) Developing the runway will force many on-site businesses to close or relocate.

3) With Wellesbourne and Wolverhampton Halfpenny Green also under threat, closing Coventry Airport will remove access to aviation for reisdents of Warwickshire and the Midlands.

4) The impact of the proposed factory will decimate the surrounding villages of Baginton and Bubenhall, amalgamating them into an industrial park.
attributes.background: The Government must intervene to prevent Coventry Airport being considered for development into the proposed gigafactory, thereby destroying aviation activity and local villages.

rejection.details:
Decisions about local joint ventures and planning decisions are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council directly. Find out how to petition your council here: https://www.coventry.gov.uk/petitions
